content.question: The figure above shows the graph of <math> <semantics> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>â€²</mo> </msup> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGabmOzayaafaaaaa@36EB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> the derivative of the function f. If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B21@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, which of the following could be the graph of f?

choices.label: A curve is plotted on the xy-plane, with the x-axis ranging from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The curve plotted on the graph moves in the form of a sinusoidal wave. It starts from the point of origin, rises upward and then slopes downward intersecting 1 on the x axis. It further slopes upward cutting the x axis at a point lying between 2 and 3 on the x axis. It rises upward and reaches a maximum height, before it shows a negative slope cutting the x axis at a point lying between 3 and 4.

A curve is plotted on the xy-plane, with the x-axis ranging from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. The curve plotted on the graph moves in the form of a sinusoidal wave. It starts from the point of origin and rises upward with its crests lying opposite 1 and 3 on the x axis, trough lying opposite 2 on the x axis.

A curve is plotted on the xy plane with the x axis ranging from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. It shows a curve starting from the origin and moving upward with a slight fall at a point opposite 3 on the x axis.

A curve is plotted on the xy plane with the x axis ranging from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. It shows a curve starting from the origin and moving upward reaching its maximum point opposite 2 on the x axis. It further slopes downward cutting the x axis at a point lying between 2 and 3. It further slopes upward cutting 4 on the x axis.

A curve is plotted on the xy plane with the x axis ranging from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. It shows a sinusoidal curve starting from the origin and moving upward reaching its maximum point opposite 1 and 3 on the x axis. It shows negative slopes with maximum falls lying below the x axis 2 and 4 on the x axis.

content.answer: A curve is plotted on the xy plane with the x axis ranging from 0 to 4, in increments of 1. It shows a curve starting from the origin and moving upward with a slight fall at a point opposite 3 on the x axis.

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
